"""Reporter"""

import os
import json
from subprocess import Popen, PIPE, STDOUT
from .utils import JSON_PATH


[docs]def show_repo_status():
    """See status of all repositories"""
    os.system("cls")
    current_dir = os.getcwd()

    with open(JSON_PATH) as rhand:
        dirs = json.load(rhand)

    git_exec = dirs["git"]

    for name, direc in dirs.items():
        if name == "git":
            continue
        knife = SwissKnife(name, direc, git_exec)
        knife.fetch()
        yield knife.status()
    os.chdir(current_dir) # return to original dir

[docs]class SwissKnife:
    """Docstring

    Parameters
    -----------
    repo_name : str
        The repository name. See list of repositories by running
    repo_dir : str
        The absolute path to the directory
    git_exec : str
        The path to the git executable on the system
	"""

    def __init__(self, repo_name, repo_dir, git_exec):
        self.name = repo_name
        self.dir = repo_dir
        self.git_exec = git_exec
        os.chdir(self.dir)
        self.current_dir = os.getcwd()


[docs]    def fetch(self):
        """git fetch"""
        process = Popen([self.git_exec, "git fetch"], shell=True,
                        stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE, stderr=STDOUT)
        # output, error = process.communicate()
        _, _ = process.communicate()



[docs]    def status(self):
        """git status"""
        self.fetch() # always do a fetch before reporting status
        process = Popen([self.git_exec, "git status"], shell=True,
                        stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE, stderr=STDOUT)
        output, _ = process.communicate()
        return str("***{}***\n{}\n".format(self.name, output.decode("utf-8")))



[docs]    def add(self, files="."):
        """git add"""
        files = "` ".join(files.split())
        add_file = 'git add {}'.format(files)
        process = Popen([self.git_exec, add_file],
                        shell=True, stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE,
                        stderr=STDOUT,)
        _, _ = process.communicate()



[docs]    def commit(self, message='minor changes'):
        """git commit"""
        # message = input("Enter commit message")
        message = "` ".join(message.split())
        process = Popen([self.git_exec, 'git', 'commit', '-m', message],
                        shell=False, stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE,
                        stderr=PIPE,)
        output, _ = process.communicate()
        return str("***{}***\n{}\n".format("Commit Done", output.decode("utf-8")))



[docs]    def push(self):

[docs]    def reset(self, number='1'):
        """git reset"""
        process = Popen([self.git_exec, 'git reset HEAD~', number], shell=True,
                        stdin=PIPE, stdout=PIPE, stderr=STDOUT,)
        _, _ = process.communicate()
        return self.status()
